intro: Gyrostachys inaequilatera, commonly known as the desert star or mountain star, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton, and is characterized by its distinctive star-shaped flowers. The plant has hairy, glandular leaves that help reduce water loss in its harsh environment. It produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in late spring or early summer. Gyrostachys inaequilatera is adapted to thrive in sandy or rocky soils with minimal rainfall.
